title.narrative: EVIDENCE FOR NATIONAL PLANNING

description.narrative: By 2021, planning departments of key social ministries have increased capacities to use evidence to plan, budget and implement national plans and policies for children in a results-based manner., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, increased inclusiveness and equity for children in national plans and policies, guided by improved budget, knowledge and data.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, planning departments of key social ministries have increased capacities to use evidence to plan, budget and implementnational plans and policies for children in a results-based manner.

description.narrative: Child-related issues were included into the 13th National Economic and Social Development Plan thanks toactive collaboration with line ministries, the National Economic and Social Development Council, the legislative branch, and local government administration. The Cabinet approved a 5 per cent increase in the budget allocation for school lunches, reflecting the minimum nutritional requirements. The success of the capacity building programme on results-based budgeting and planning for 36 local government administrators led to the adoption of the curriculum by theLocal Government Human Resource Training Institute. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
